channel.title: M.J. Tattersall Author's Page
channel.description: Recent content on M.J. Tattersall Author's Page

item.title: About the Author
item.description: M.J. Tattersall is a writer and PhD academic based out of the Department of English Literature and Creative Writing at Lancaster University, UK. He is currently writing a novel about John Ruskin’s silent decade, 1890-1900, and is fascinated by Ruskin’s continuing relevance today. The novel, which is being written in part-fulfilment of M.J.’s doctoral research, explores neo-Victorian and epistolary fiction’s relevance to notions of s√©ance as well as their links to the prophetic biblical patterning of Ruskin’s own works.

item.title: pipe test
item.description: this is a test to see how I can streamline the flow between hugo and github pages

item.title: Welcome to my website
item.description: Hello. Welcome to my website. Here you will find information relating to my work as a novelist and academic. Please feel free to check out my professional links, and posts containing updates on my work to date. The site is completely barebones at the minute as I am in the (very slow) process of creating a website with no prior coding experiences. All languages are beautiful–even computer-speak– but it’s always hard work learning new ones.
